product.name: Water Leak Detector
product.keywords: Utilitech, Everspring, indoor, water, leak, flood, sensor, safety, zwave, battery

step1.text: Remove the screw on the back of the water leak detector, then slide and lift off the face plate.

step2.text: Remove the screw and lift the battery cover.

step3.text: Insert batteries and press the button once. The hub will beep when pairing is complete.

step0.text: TIP: Do not use other Iris devices at this time to avoid removing them. It is best if the device is within 10 feet of the hub.

step1.text: Unscrew the battery cover.

step2.text: With batteries inserted, press the pair key once.

step3.text: The hub will beep when the device is successfully removed.

step1.text: With batteries inserted, press the pair button under the battery cover 8 times, allowing one second between presses.

step2.text: The LED should flash to indicate a successful reset.

step3.text: Once reset, press the pair button once to enter pairing mode.

step2.text: Turn on the power to the light, and press the button. The hub will beep and the light bulb will flash 3 times when pairing is complete.

step1.text: Press the Learn button 8 times within a 5 second interval.

step2.text: The lamp module should now be reset. Press the Learn button once to reenter pairing mode.

step1.text: Plug in the smoke listener. The hub will beep when pairing is complete.
The hub will beep when the device is successfully removed.
Unplug the device. Using a paperclip, press and hold the small Test button just below the LED.

step2.text: While holding the button, plug in the device.

step3.text: When the LED blinks blue, release the Test button. Press the button again to enter pairing mode.

Press and hold the power button for about 10 seconds, until the LED blinks red, then release the button.

step2.text: Press and hold the Halo button for about 20 seconds. Release the button when Halo says, "Erasing all your settings."

product.name: Smoke Detector
product.keywords: First, Alert, smoke, fire, detector, sensor, safety, alarm, indoor, zwave, battery

step1.text: Slide the battery drawer open.

step2.text: Insert batteries, ensuring correct orientation.

step3.text: Press and hold the test button on the front of the device. Keep it held down as you slide the battery drawer closed, then release the button. The hub will beep when pairing is complete.

step0.text: TIP: Do not use other Iris devices at this time to avoid removing them. It is best if the device is within 10 feet of the hub.

step1.text: Open the battery slide. On the device, press and hold the Test button.

step2.text: While sliding the battery drawer closed, continue hodling down the Test button until you hear a short beep, and then release the Test button.

step3.text: The hub will beep when the device is successfully removed.

step1.text: Start at the app's dashboard. Tap on the navigation menu (≡) and select Devices.

step2.text: Scroll to the bottom of the list to find the Z-Wave Tools. Tap on this, then tap Remove Z-Wave Devices. Remain on this screen until step 5 is complete.

step3.text: Go to the smoke detector. Open the battery drawer and wait 5 seconds.

step4.text: Press and hold the button the front of the device while sliding the battery drawer closed.

step5.text: When the device beeps, release the button. This will reset the smoke detector, indicated by the hub beeping twice. When you see the onscreen confirmation in the app, tap Done to leave the screen and take the hub out of Z-Wave removal mode.

product.name: Touchscreen Thermostat (Z-Wave)
product.keywords: Honeywell, indoor, thermostat, programmable, 7, day, touchscreen, climate, hvac, heater, air, conditioner, zwave, battery, TH8320ZW

step1.text: Install the thermostat as described in the manufacturer's instructions and set the correct time and date.

step2.text: Press the 'System' button once, then press and hold both indicated keys until the thermostat screen changes to show up / down arrows.

step3.text: Press the leftmost down arrow until the screen shows 'rf10'. Use the rightmost arrows to select '1'. The thermostat is now in pairing mode. The hub will beep when pairing is complete.

step4.text: To enable the 'Auto' thermostat setting, use the leftmost arrows to select '0300'. Use the rightmost arrows to select '1'. Press the 'DONE' button in the bottom left corner.

step0.text: TIP: Do not use other Iris devices at this time to avoid removing them. It is best if the device is within 10 feet of the hub.

step1.text: Press System on the thermostat's touch screen.

step2.text: To the right of the Done button, simultaneously press and hold the second and fourth blank square.

step3.text: On the left, press the Up Arrow to select rF 10.

step4.text: On the right, press the Down Arrow to select 0.

step5.text: The hub will beep when the device is successfully removed.

step1.text: On the thermostat, press SYSTEM, then press and hold the third and fifth buttons at the bottom together until the display changes.

step2.text: Use the left set of arrows to change the function to 0710. Then, use the right set of arrows to change the number from 0 to 1.

step3.text: The thermostat will restart itself. This resets installer options, the Z-Wave configuration, and any programming schedules saved. Date and time settings are retained.

product.name: Programmable Thermostat
product.keywords: Iris, GoControl, indoor, thermostat, programmable, 7, day, climate, hvac, heater, air, conditioner, zwave, battery

step1.text: Install the thermostat as described in the manufacturer's instructions.

step2.text: Press and hold the FAN button until the screen changes to the SETUP screen. Press and hold the UP button until the ZWAVE is shown on the status line.

step3.text: Press Select. INSTALL should be shown on the status line. If so, press SELECT.

step4.text: When SUCCESS is shown on the status line, press DONE to exit the ZWAVE screen and press DONE again to exit the SETUP screen. The hub will beep when pairing is complete.

step0.text: TIP: Do not use other Iris devices at this time to avoid removing them. It is best if the device is within 10 feet of the hub.

step1.text: Hold the Fan button until the screen changes to the Setup menu.

step2.text: Press the Up button until ZWAVE is shown on the status Line, then press SELECT. (Note: Remove should be shown on the status line).

step3.text: Press SELECT again.

step4.text: The hub will beep when the device is successfully removed.

step1.text: Remove the thermostat from the wall and remove batteries, if installed.

step2.text: Hold down the MODE and FAN buttons simultaneously while powering up.

step3.text: Release when RESET appears on the Status Line. Once the TBZ48 resets the Z-Wave and HVAC settings, a DONE confirmation message will appear on the screen before the thermostat self-reboots.

product.name: Lever Lock (FE599)
product.keywords: Schlage, Camelot, Century, Plymouth, door, lever, lock, entry, keypad, zwave, FE599IR, battery

step1.text: For simplicity, PIN codes are managed through the people you invite to your home. Iris will automatically delete any PIN codes manually entered on the lock itself.

step2.text: Make a note of the 6 digit program code located on the inside of the lock. Follow the manufacturer's installation instructions.

step3.text: Ensure the batteries are properly installed. Enter the six digit program code. Wait for the Schlage button to flash and beep three times.

step4.text: Press the Schlage button once, then press the number 0. The hub will beep when pairing is complete.

step0.text: TIP: Do not use other Iris devices at this time to avoid removing them. It is best if the device is within 10 feet of the hub.

step1.text: On the lock, press the Schlage button, enter the 6 digit program code located on the inside of the lock, and then after the Schlage button flashes, press 0.

step2.text: The green check mark on the lock will illuminate.

step3.text: The hub will beep when the device is successfully removed.

step1.text: Disconnect the lock's batteries.

step2.text: Press and hold the Schlage button on the outside while replacing the batteries.

step3.text: Release the Schlage button. To check that the lock was reset, enter one of the default user codes found on the back of the lock and its manual.

step4.text: If the lock was correctly reset and the user code entered was correct, the lock will perform a setup routine and will then be fully reset.

step5.text: To reenter pairing mode, enter the 6 digit program code found on the inside of the lock, press the Schlage button, then press 0.

product.name: Touchscreen Deadbolt (BE469)
product.keywords: Schlage, Camelot, Century, Plymouth, door, deadbolt, lock, touchscreen, BE469, entry, zwave, battery

step1.text: For simplicity, PIN codes are managed through the people you invite to your home. Iris will automatically delete any PIN codes manually entered on the lock itself.

step2.text: Make a note of the 6 digit program code located on the inside of the lock. Follow the manufacturer's installation instructions.

step3.text: Ensure the batteries are properly installed. Press the Schlage button once and enter the 6 digit program code. The orange light will begin to slowly flash.

step4.text: Finally, press the number 0 once. The hub will beep and the green check mark will illuminate when pairing is complete.

step0.text: TIP: Do not use other Iris devices at this time to avoid removing them. It is best if the device is within 10 feet of the hub.

step1.text: On the lock, press the Schlage button, enter the 6 digit program code located on the inside of the lock, and then after the orange light flashes, press 0.

step2.text: The green check mark on the lock will illuminate.

step3.text: The hub will beep when the device is successfully removed.

step1.text: Disconnect the lock's batteries.

step2.text: Press and hold the Schlage button on the outside while replacing the batteries.

step3.text: Release the Schlage button. To check that the lock was reset, enter one of the default user codes found on the back of the lock and its manual.

step4.text: If the lock was correctly reset and the user code entered was correct, the lock will perform a setup routine and will then be fully reset.

step5.text: To reenter pairing mode, enter the 6 digit program code found on the inside of the lock, press the Schlage button, then press 0.

product.name: Contact Sensor (Model 3320-L)
product.keywords: CentraLite, Iris, contact, temperature door, window, sensor, zigbee, security, alarm, battery

step1.text: Remove the battery tab labeled "Remove to Pair". The hub will beep when pairing is complete.
The hub will beep when the device is successfully removed.
Remove the battery and wait ten seconds.

step2.text: Using a paper clip, press and hold the reset button while reinserting the battery. Hold for an additional two seconds and release. The contact sensor should begin blinking blue. Note: The reset button is a small black button above the battery.

product.name: Motion Sensor (Model 3326-L)
product.keywords: CentraLite, Iris, motion, PIR, infrared, passive, sensor, zigbee, security, alarm, indoor, battery

step1.text: Remove the battery door. Remove the battery tab labeled "Remove to Pair". The hub will beep when pairing is complete.
The hub will beep when the device is successfully removed.
Remove the battery and wait ten seconds.

step2.text: Press and hold the reset button on the side of the device while reinserting the battery. Hold for an additional two seconds and release. Note: The reset button is a small white button located on the side of the motion sensor.

product.name: Smart Button
product.keywords: CentraLite, Iris, smart, panic, button, doorbell, zigbee, indoor, control, battery

step1.text: Remove the battery tab labeled "Remove to Pair". The hub will beep when pairing is complete.
The hub will beep when the device is successfully removed.
Remove the battery and wait ten seconds.

step2.text: Reinstall the battery. Once the battery is installed, push the button five times in a row, once per second.

step3.text: Confirm that the button has been reset by checking that the background light is flashing blue. If it does not do this, retry step 2.

product.name: Smart Plug (Model 3210-L)
product.keywords: CentraLite, Iris, indoor, module, control, outlet, smart, plug, switch, energy, 120, volt, power, zigbee

step1.text: Insert the smart plug into the wall receptacle. Ensure the wall receptacle is powered. The hub will beep when pairing is complete.
The hub will beep when the device is successfully removed.
Remove the Smart Plug from the outlet and wait ten seconds.

step2.text: Press and hold the small white button on front of the plug. While holding the button, insert the Smart Plug back into the outlet. As soon as the LED on the front of the plug lights up, release the button.

product.name: Security Keypad (Model 3405-L)
product.keywords: CentraLite, Iris, smart, zigbee, security, safety, panic, alarm, keypad, indoor, battery

step1.text: Remove the mounting bracket from the back of the keypad and remove the battery cover.

step2.text: Remove the battery tab labeled "Remove to Pair". The hub will beep when pairing is complete.

step1.text: The hub will beep when the device is successfully removed.
Remove the battery.

step2.text: Press and hold the tamper switch while inserting one battery. Hold tamper switch for two seconds after the battery is installed, then release. Note: The tamper switch is the little flat plastic tab located on the back where the mounting bracket connects to the device.

product.name: Smart Fob
product.keywords: CentraLite, Iris, smart, key, fob, button, control, arm, disarm, zigbee, indoor, presence, battery

step1.text: Insert the battery so the plus sign is facing to you.

step2.text: Close the battery door and tighten it using either your fingernails or a coin. The hub will beep when pairing is complete.

step1.text: The hub will beep when the device is successfully removed.
Twist open the battery cover on the back of the Smart Fob. Remove the battery and wait ten seconds.

step2.text: Reinstall the battery with the positive side facing you. Once the battery is installed, push any of the four buttons five times in a row, once per second.

step3.text: Confirm that the fob has been reset by checking that the fob's background light is flashing blue. If it does not do this, retry step 2.

product.name: Thermostat (CT101)
product.keywords: Iris, indoor, thermostat, humidity, fan, control, programmable, 7, day, climate, hvac, heater, air, conditioner, zwave, ct101, battery

step1.text: Install the thermostat as described in the manufacturer's instructions.

step2.text: Press the Menu button once, then press 'Mate' twice. The word 'Mate' will flash on the display. The LINK icon will flash and the Hub will beep when pairing is complete.

step0.text: TIP: Do not use other Iris devices at this time to avoid removing them. It is best if the device is within 10 feet of the hub.

step1.text: On the thermostat, select "Mode" and then "Menu".

step2.text: Select and hold the "Link" touchscreen button for 25 seconds. The green and yellow LEDs on the left side of the screen will flash and the word "Link" will disappear.

step3.text: The hub will beep when the device is successfully removed.

step1.text: Remove the batteries for two minutes, then replace them.

step2.text: On the thermostat, select "Mode" and then "Menu".

step3.text: Select and hold the "Link" touchscreen button for 25 seconds. The green and yellow LEDs on the left side of the screen will flash and the word "Link" will disappear.

step4.text: Remove the top cover plate and hold the "Reset" button for 5 seconds.

step5.text: Remove the batteries for another two minutes, then replace them. The thermostat is now reset.

step3.text: Set the dial to "Auto". The antenna icon will flash and then remain solid, and the hub will beep when paring is complete.

step1.text: The hub will beep when the device is successfully removed.

step2.text: The device is now in pairing mode. Device settings like time of day will not be reset.

product.keywords: Linear, GoControl, motion, PIR, infrared, passive, sensor, zwave, security, alarm, indoor, battery

step1.text: Insert battery and Replace Cover. Press button with a paper clip. The hub will beep when pairing is complete.

product.name: Glass Break Sensor
product.keywords: Utilitech, Linear, glassbreak, glass, break, alarm, security, zwave, battery

step1.text: Install the glass break sensor as described in the manufacturer's instructions.

step2.text: Insert the included batteries and press the button on the glass break sensor once.

step3.text: An LED light will flash on the sensor until it has paired with Iris. The hub will beep when pairing is complete.

step0.text: TIP: Do not use other Iris devices at this time to avoid removing them. It is best if the device is within 10 feet of the hub.

step1.text: Press the button on the glass break sensor once.

step2.text: The hub will beep when the device is successfully removed.

step1.text: Press the button on the glass break sensor once.

product.name: Water Shut-Off Valve
product.keywords: Waxman, Leak Smark, water, shut, off, insurance, zigbee, leak, flow, battery

step1.text: Pull the enclosure off the valve. The enclosure can be powered using the adapter or batteries. If both are used the batteries provide back-up power.

step2.text: Use a screw driver to remove the battery cover. Lift out the battery drawer, insert 4 batteries and place the battery drawer and cover back in the valve.

step3.text: To power the valve with AC power, connect the plug to the socket on the base of the device and plug into a power outlet.

step4.text: Push the enclosure back onto the valve. The blue LED will flash until it has been paired with Iris. The hub will beep when pairing is complete.

step5.text: Now you can install the valve as described in the manufacturer's instructions.

step1.text: The hub will beep when the device is successfully removed.
On the water valve, press the center button five times in a row, once per second. This is the button with the wireless radio tower icon.

step2.text: Confirm that the water valve's blue light is now blinking twice every 2 seconds. This means the device has been reset.

product.name: Water Leak Sensor
product.keywords: Waxman, Leak Smark, water, insurance, zigbee, leak, battery, sensor

step1.text: Use a screwdriver to remove the battery cover.

step2.text: Insert the included batteries, then press the pairing button once. The LED will blink rapidly.

step3.text: The hub will beep when pairing is complete. Once paired, re-attach the battery cover, then place in its final location.

step1.text: The hub will beep when the device is successfully removed.
Open the battery cover and remove all batteries for 10 seconds.

step2.text: Insert all but one of the batteries, and then hold down the sensor button (inside the battery cover) for 10 seconds while inserting the last battery.

product.name: Tilt Sensor
product.keywords: Nyce, tilt, sensor, garage, alarm, security, zigbee, battery

step1.text: Slide open the tilt sensor's cover.

step2.text: Insert a battery, or remove the plastic battery tab if a battery is already installed. An LED light will flash and the hub will beep when pairing is complete.

step3.text: Once paired, replace the cover by sliding it onto the sensor. Install the tilt sensor with the groove vertical and on the right-hand side, as shown in the image.

step1.text: The hub will beep when the device is successfully removed.

For a Gen 1 NYCE Tilt Sensor: Remove the top housing and press the revealed button 5 times. If the device reset successfully, you should see the LED turn red for 2 seconds. Now your device should be reset. The device will automatically try to pair with the hub upon reset.

step2.text: For a Gen 2 NYCE Tilt Sensor: Remove the top housing and press the revealed button 10 times. If the device reset successfully, you should see the LED blink red three times, then green five times. Now your device should be reset. The device will automatically try to pair with the hub upon reset.

product.name: Door Hinge Sensor
product.keywords: Nyce, hinge, sensor, alarm, security, zigbee, battery, door, contact

step1.text: Position the door hinge sensor near the final installation location, but do not install it yet. Remove the plastic battery tab located on the back-side slot.

step2.text: The LED on the front-side of the sensor will show a sequence of yellow - red - yellow that indicates it is ready for pairing. During the pairing process, it will show a sequence of yellow - green - yellow.

step3.text: The LED will flash green three times and the hub will beep when pairing is complete.

step4.text: It's now time to mount the sensor to the door as described in the manufacturer's instructions.

step1.text: The hub will beep when the device is successfully removed.
To begin, press the outer button 10 times. A series of lights will blink. Your device should be reset, and the device will automatically move into pairing mode upon reset.

product.name: Ceiling Motion Sensor
product.keywords: Nyce, motion, PIR, infrared, passive, sensor, zigbee, security, alarm, indoor, battery

step1.text: Twist open the motion sensor's cover.

step2.text: Insert two batteries. An LED light will flash and the hub will beep when pairing is complete.

step3.text: Once paired, install the motion sensor as shown in the instructions.

step1.text: The hub will beep when the device is successfully removed.

product.name: Indoor Siren
product.keywords: Utilitech, Everspring, siren, 85, decibel, alarm, security, zwave, sound, battery

step1.text: Loosen screw, then slide and lift the cover.

step2.text: Insert batteries, ensuring correct orientation.

step3.text: Press the button located between the batteries. The hub will beep when pairing is complete.

step0.text: TIP: Do not use other Iris devices at this time to avoid removing them. It is best if the device is within 10 feet of the hub.

step1.text: Unscrew the battery cover.

step2.text: With batteries inserted, press the pair key once.

step3.text: The hub will beep when the device is successfully removed.

step1.text: Press the pair button between the batteries 3 times within 1.5 seconds, then hold the pair button for 5 seconds until the LED turns off.

step2.text: The device is now reset. Press the pair button 3 times again to enter pairing mode.

product.name: 1st Gen Contact Sensor
product.keywords: AlertMe, Iris, contact, temperature, door, window, sensor, zigbee, security, alarm, battery, DWS901

step1.text: Squeeze both sides together on the semi-circles and then pull off the back cover.

step2.text: Insert the battery on top of the battery tab, ensuring correct orientation by matching the black dots.

step3.text: Replace the cover, ensuring the tabs are aligned. The light on the sensor will flash, and the hub will beep when pairing is complete.

step1.text: The hub will beep when the device is successfully removed.
Remove the battery for at least 10 seconds.

step2.text: Press the tamper button eight or more times, allowing one second between presses.

step3.text: The green light on the sensor will flash when it has returned to pairing mode.

product.name: 1st Gen Motion Sensor
product.keywords: AlertMe, Iris, motion, PIR, infrared, passive, sensor, zigbee, security, alarm, indoor, battery, MOT501

step1.text: Squeeze both sides together on the raised edges and then pull off the back cover.

step2.text: Insert the battery on top of the battery tab, ensuring correct orientation.

step3.text: Replace the cover, ensuring the tabs are aligned. The light on the sensor will flash, and the hub will beep when pairing is complete.

step1.text: The hub will beep when the device is successfully removed.
Remove the battery for at least 10 seconds.

step2.text: Press the tamper button eight or more times, allowing one second between presses.

step3.text: The green light on the sensor will flash when it has returned to pairing mode.

product.name: 1st Gen Smart Button
product.keywords: AlertMe, Iris, smart, panic, button, doorbell, zigbee, indoor, control, battery, BTN900

step1.text: Squeeze both sides together on the raised edges and then pull off the back cover

step2.text: Insert the battery on top of the battery tab, ensuring correct orientation.

step3.text: Replace the cover, ensuring the tabs are aligned. The light on the sensor will flash, and the hub will beep when pairing is complete.

step1.text: The hub will beep when the device is successfully removed.
Remove the battery for at least 10 seconds.

step2.text: Within 10 seconds of reinserting the battery, press the tamper button eight or more times, allowing one second between presses.

step3.text: The green light on the button will flash when it has returned to pairing mode.

product.name: 1st Gen Key Fob
product.keywords: AlertMe, Iris, smart, keyfob, key, fob, button, control, arm, disarm, zigbee, indoor, presence, battery, KEY903

step1.text: Insert the supplied access tool into the small opening at the top of the key fob. Use the tool as a lever to open the key fob.

step2.text: Insert the battery, ensuring correct orientation.

step3.text: Slide the cover back on, and then squeeze the key fob closed. The key fob will flash, and the hub will beep when pairing is complete.

step1.text: The hub will beep when the device is successfully removed.
Remove the key fob from Iris if paired. Otherwise, resetting the fob will trigger its function as pressing the button is necessary.

step2.text: Insert the supplied access tool into the small opening at the top of the key fob. Use the tool as a lever to open the key fob.

step3.text: Remove the battery for at least 10 seconds.

step4.text: Within 10 seconds of reinserting the battery, press either button eight or more times, allowing one second between presses.

step5.text: The green light on the fob will flash when it has returned to pairing mode.

product.name: 1st Gen Smart Plug
product.keywords: AlertMe, Iris, indoor, module, control, outlet, smart, plug, switch, energy, 120, volt, power, zigbee, SPG902

step1.text: Plug the Smart Plug into an outlet that is no more than 10 feet from your hub in order to pair it (you can move it after pairing).

step2.text: The light on the front of the Smart Plug will flash, and the hub will beep when pairing is complete. You may now move the plug to your preferred outlet.

step1.text: The hub will beep when the device is successfully removed.
Unplug the smart plug from the outlet. Hold the button on the front for at least 15 seconds, then replace the smart plug.

step2.text: Immediately press the front button eight or more times, allowing one second between presses.

step3.text: The smart plug is now back in pairing mode.

product.name: 1st Gen Security Keypad
product.keywords: AlertMe, Iris, smart, zigbee, security, safety, panic, alarm, keypad, key, pad, battery, KDP901

step1.text: Remove the back of the keypad using a screwdriver.

step2.text: Insert the batteries, ensuring correct orientation, then close the cover.

step3.text: The "On" light will flash, and the hub will beep when pairing is complete. You may now install the keypad in its preferred location.

step1.text: The hub will beep when the device is successfully removed.
Remove the keypad from Iris if paired. Otherwise, resetting the keypad will result in arming the alarm.

step2.text: Remove all of the batteries and wait 30 seconds.

step3.text: Replace two batteries and press the ON button eight or more times, allowing one second between presses.

step4.text: The green light on the keypad will flash when it has returned to pairing mode.

product.name: 1st Gen Care Pendant
product.keywords: AlertMe, Iris, senior, pendant, panic, indoor, zigbee, battery, care, safety, presence, PDT900

step1.text: Insert the supplied access tool into the small opening at the top of the care pendant. Use the tool as a lever to open the pendant.

step2.text: Insert the battery, ensuring correct orientation.

step3.text: Slide the cover back on, and then squeeze the care pendant closed. The pendant will flash, and the hub will beep when pairing is complete.

step1.text: The hub will beep when the device is successfully removed.
Remove the care pendant from Iris if paired. Otherwise, resetting the pendant may trigger a care alarm.

step2.text: Insert the supplied access tool into the small opening at the top of the care pendant. Use the tool as a lever to open the pendant.

step3.text: Remove the battery for at least 10 seconds.

step4.text: Within 10 seconds of reinserting the battery, press either button at least 8 times, allowing one second between presses

step5.text: The green light on the pendant will flash when it has returned to pairing mode.

product.name: Vent
product.keywords: Keen, vent, fan, control, climate, hvac, heater, air, conditioner, zigbee, battery

step1.text: Before installing the vent, remove the battery tab. The hub will beep when pairing is complete.
The hub will beep when the device is successfully removed.
Locate the black button the bottom of the vent and press five times. (You will need to remove the vent from the wall or ceiling to access the button.)

product.name: Touchscreen Lever Lock (YRL 220 Z-Wave)
product.keywords: Yale, real, living, door, lever, lock, touchscreen, YRL220, entry, zwave, battery

step1.text: For simplicity, PIN codes are managed through the people you invite to your home. Iris will automatically delete any PIN codes manually entered on the lock itself.

step2.text: Install the lock as described in the manufacturer's instructions, then change the master PIN so that it is 5 or more numbers long. Note: Do not use your Iris PIN as a master PIN.

step3.text: Touch the keypad with your palm to activate it. Once activated, enter the master PIN, then press #. The 'P key' will turn red. Next press '7, #'.

step4.text: Press '1, #' to add the lock to Iris. The lock and hub will beep when pairing is complete.

step0.text: TIP: Do not use other Iris devices at this time to avoid removing them. It is best if the device is within 10 feet of the hub.

step1.text: On the lock, enter the master code, and then press 7.

step2.text: Press #, and after the keypad flashes red, press 3.

step3.text: Press #. The hub will beep when the device is successfully removed.

step1.text: Remove the battery cover and batteries, then remove the interior side of the lock to access the reset button.

step2.text: Hold the reset button for at least 3 seconds while reinstalling the batteries.

step3.text: Replace the battery cover and create a new master PIN code.

step4.text: The lock can now be put in pairing mode by entering [Master PIN] - # - 7 - # - 1 - #

product.name: Indoor Camera
product.keywords: Sercom, Sercomm, Iris, camera, video, picture, stream, streaming, record, recording, wifi, wi-fi, ethernet, wireless, night, vision, HD, high, definition, 720p, motion, PIR, IR, indoor, 8221, RC8221

step1.text: Before plugging the camera into an outlet, connect it to a network port on your router using the supplied Ethernet cable.

step2.text: Now plug the camera into a power outlet using the supplied power cord. The hub will beep when the camera is found (this may take up to 5 minutes).

step1.text: The hub will beep when the device is successfully removed.
Connect the camera to a network port on your router router using the supplied Ethernet cable..

step2.text: Power on the camera for at least 3 minutes.

step3.text: Using a paper clip, fully depress the reset button for no less than 30 seconds.

step4.text: The camera should click and reboot after the reset button is released. The camera will be ready to pair after approximately 3 minutes.

product.name: Indoor/Outdoor Camera

step1.text: Open the rubber cover from the micro-USB port on the back of the camera and insert the micro-USB adapter.

step2.text: Insert the supplied Ethernet cord into the micro-USB adapter and connect it to a network port on your router.

step3.text: Unscrew the lock ring around the power cord and remove the rubber gasket. Next, insert the power cord through the lock ring.

step4.text: Place the rubber gasket around the tip of the power cord and tighten the lock ring to the camera base.

step2.text: Power on the camera for at least 3 minutes.

step3.text: Using a paper clip, fully depress the reset button for no less than 15 seconds.

step4.text: The camera should click and reboot after the reset button is released. The camera will be ready to pair after approximately 3 minutes.

product.name: Electric Water Heater Controller

step1.text: Install the water heater controller as described in the manufacturer's instructions.

step2.text: Wait until the connection LED shows solid green. Make a note of the water heater ID that is shown on the control panel sticker. The 12 digit code is printed on the Wi-Fi module and is also on the user guide cover.

step3.text: Enter the 12 digit code and the water heater model and serial numbers, located on the label beneath the Energy Smart™ controls.

step1.text: Please wait for the device to be removed from the Iris Cloud Platform. If this takes longer than a few seconds, consider factory resetting the device.

step2.text: The green Connection Status light will flash twice, then remain solid when ready to connect.

product.name: Pet Door
product.keywords: PetSafe, door, entry, lock, dog, cat, zigbee, battery

step2.text: Insert batteries checking the correct orientation and replace the cover.

step1.text: The hub will beep when the device is successfully removed.
Press the MODE-RESET button on the pet door five times in a row, allowing one second between presses.

step2.text: The blue LINK light should begin flashing. The device is now in pairing mode.

product.name: Blind Controller
product.keywords: blinds, shades, springs, bali, zwave, battery

step1.text: Connect and power the blinds controller as described in the printed instructions.

step2.text: Press the left arrow to display Z-WAVE OPTIONS. Select it by pressing the center button. Use the arrows to find BASE NODE. Press the center button to select it.

step3.text: Use the arrows to select BASE NODE INCLUDE and then press the center button. Once paired, the controller will read BASE INCLUDE SUCCESS and the hub will beep.

step0.text: TIP: Do not use other Iris devices at this time to avoid removing. It is best if the device is within 10 feet of the hub.

step1.text: Ensure that all blinds and or shades are removed from the controller.

step2.text: Use the arrow keys on the controller to find Z-WAVE OPTIONS and select it using the center button.

step3.text: Use the arrows to find BASE NODE and select it using the center button.

step4.text: Find and select BASE NODE EXCLUDE. The controller will show EXCLUDE SUCCESS once the blind is removed.

step1.text: Use the arrow keys on the controller to navigate to ADVANCED OPTIONS and press Select.

step2.text: Navigate to Z-WAVE RESET and press Select.

step3.text: Navigate to PROCEED WITH Z-WAVE RESET and press Select.

step4.text: Navigate to ARE YOU SURE? and press Select.

step5.text: The controller will display Z-WAVE RESETTING and then Z-WAVE RESET SUCCESS or Z-WAVE RESET FAIL.

step6.text: If the reset succeeds, navigate to Z-WAVE OPTIONS -> BASE NODE -> BASE NODE INCLUDE to reenter pairing mode.

step1.text: A blinds controller must be paired before pairing blinds. If you've already done that, tap NEXT. Keep your remote, you'll need it to set the Favorite position.

step2.text: Pair the blinds with the controller as described in the printed instructions included with the controller. Make a note of each blind's channel number.

step3.text: Use the arrow buttons to find Z-WAVE OPTIONS and press the center button. Then use the arrows to find VIRTUAL NODE and press the center button.

step4.text: Use the arrow buttons to find VIRTUAL NODE INCLUDE and press the center button.

step5.text: Use the arrows to find the virtual node number that matches blind channel number and press the center button. The hub will beep when pairing is complete and the controller will read INCLUDE SUCCESS.

step0.text: TIP: Do not use other Iris devices at this time to avoid removing. It is best if the Blind Controller is within 10 feet of the hub.

step1.text: Use the arrow keys on the controller to find Z-WAVE OPTIONS and select it using the center button.

step2.text: Use the arrows to find VIRTUAL NODE and select it using the center button.

step3.text: Find and select VIRTUAL NODE EXCLUDE then find and select the channel number of the virtual node that you wish to remove.
The controller will show EXCLUDE SUCCESS once the blind is removed.

step1.text: Use a paper clip to depress the PROGRAM button located on the motor head. The LED light will start flashing.

step2.text: When the LED turns off (or after 15 seconds), release the PROGRAM button.

step3.text: The blinds are now reset and can be paired to the controller.

step1.text: Turn off the power to the light, then screw the light bulb into the fitting.

step2.text: Turn on the power to the light and the bulb will flash. The hub will beep and the bulb will flash again when pairing is complete.

step1.text: The hub will beep when the device is successfully removed.

step2.text: Repeat the previous step 4 more times for 5 cycles total.

step3.text: After 5 cycles, wait 10 seconds. If the reset was successful, the light will flash and enter pairing mode.

step2.text: Wait 5 seconds and press the pad back into the frame. Hold it until the locator LED turns amber and then flashes red.

step3.text: The switch is now reset. Press the push pad once to reenter pairing mode.

step1.text: The hub will beep when the device is successfully removed.
Open the contact sensor's battery cover.

step2.text: Press the tamper switch once.
